title: Questions, takeaways from NFL Week 16: Resilient Bears pull out OT thriller; Eagles repeat as NFC East champs
description: Our NFL Nation reporters answer big questions from each Week 16 game. Here's what you need to know.

title: 'Been There, Won That': Eagles clinch NFC East
description: The Eagles clinched their second straight NFC East title by beating the Commanders 29-18 on Saturday night.

title: Eagles go for 2, igniting brawl; Sirianni backs play
description: An on-field fight resulted in three players being ejected in Saturday's Eagles-Commanders game after Philadelphia, up by 17 late in the fourth quarter, decided to go for a 2-point conversion.

title: Oregon beats JMU for first CFP win since 2014
description: No. 5 Oregon beat No. 19 James Madison 51-34 on Saturday night in a College Football Playoff opener, the Ducks' first CFP win since 2014.

title: Texas Tech jolts unbeaten Duke with 17-point rally
description: No. 19 Texas Tech rallied from 17 down to beat third-ranked Duke 82-81 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Packers' Love concussed after hard hit vs. Bears
description: Green Bay Packers quarterback Jordan Love was ruled out of Saturday's game against the Chicago Bears because of a concussion after he took a helmet hit from defensive end Austin Booker in the second quarter.

title: For Ole Miss, a gratifying 1st CFP win without Kiffin
description: Tony Golding and Ole Miss passed their first test since Lane Kiffin's abrupt departure, blowing out Tulane on Saturday to earn the Rebels their first CFP victory.

title: Miami's defense dominates A&M for first CFP win
description: Miami's defense recorded nine tackles for loss and three takeaways, including a game-sealing interception in the end zone to cap a 10-3 Hurricanes win over Texas A&M in the College Football Playoff on Saturday.

description: The 2026 Winter Olympics will be Knight's last playing for Team USA. She remains one of the faces of U.S. women's hockey.

title: Risers and fallers: Add Dylan Harper, Cam Spencer for instant offense
description: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Gurney beats Greaves in deciding set at PDC Worlds
description: Beau Greaves falls just short of becoming the second female player to win a match at the PDC World Championship, losing a deciding set to 22nd seed Daryl Gurney.

title: Fifa owes fans thousands for resold World Cup tickets
description: Customers who resold World Cup tickets on Fifa‚Äôs official platform say they are still waiting for thousands of pounds in payments.

title: Unsung heroes and trailblazers - Rooney and Allardyce on management
description: Wayne Rooney and Sam Allardyce discuss management, club owners and rewarding staff at football clubs in the latest episode of The Wayne Rooney Show

title: TNT Sports replaces BBC as Commonwealths live broadcaster
description: The subscription channel takes over from the BBC which had been the principal partner since 1954 and provided free-to-air coverage.

title: From Helmand to Milan - Meenagh's quest for Winter Paralympic medal
description: Scotland's Scott Meenagh is targeting a first medal at his third and final Winter Paralympics, 14 years on from losing both his legs in Helmand Province

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 16
description: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Bo Nix and six other potential playoff heroes
description: We don't get to know the script, but the facts portend who has a chance to play hero.

title: Sutton's predictions v Zambian rapper Sampa the Great
description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Zambian rapper Sampa the Great - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

title: All the Sports Personality 2025 winners
description: All the award winners at BBC Sports Personality of the Year 2025, as Rory McIlroy claims the top prize.

title: Remembering the sports stars we lost in 2025
description: A host of figures from the world of sport died in 2025 - BBC Sport remembers some of those sporting names.

title: Salah seeks Afcon success with Egypt as Morocco eye home glory
description: Two of African football's biggest names, Achraf Hakimi and Mohamed Salah, are hoping to lead their nations to glory as the Africa Cup of Nations gets ready to kick off in Morocco.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: What next for friendly foes who see each other 'more than family'?
description: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz have dominated men‚Äôs tennis in 2025. BBC Sport looks at the evolution of their growing rivalry ‚Äì and where it could go next.

title: 'It felt like God's hand on my brain' - the day England were humbled by teenager
description: BBC Sport's From The Ashes series concludes with the inside story of Ashton Agar's record-breaking introduction to Test cricket as a 19-year-old batting at number 11.
